long_desc: This course surveys the evolution of European culture from 15001950. It defines culture broadly to include not only philosophy, literature, and art but also science, manners, sexuality, morality, and religion. Lectures, readings, and discussions will introduce students to European thinking and writing on these questions. The course will place cultural change in the context of politics and society. Readings will include historical studies, novels, plays, and memoirs. Assignments will include six 3page essays and one 6page essay.
name: Development of European Culture
